CONJUGATES: caption (n.) | captions (n. plural) | caption (v.) | captions (v. 3rd pers. singular present) | captioning (v. present participle) | captioned (v. past simple, v. past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French capcion 'seizure, arrest', from Latin captio 'a taking, seizing', later developing the sense of a heading or title (influenced by 'capitulum' - 'chapter, heading').
SINCE: Late Middle English (15th century for the legal sense, 19th century for the sense of text accompanying an illustration)

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A title or brief explanation accompanying an illustration, photograph, cartoon, or document.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 附在图片、照片、漫画或文件下方作说明的文字或标题。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The photograph had a witty caption that made everyone laugh.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那张照片配了一段诙谐的说明文字，逗得大家哈哈大笑。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To provide an illustration, photograph, or document with a title or explanation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 为插图、照片或文件添加标题或说明。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She captioned her Instagram post with a poetic quote.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她在自己的Instagram帖子中配上了一段诗意的引文。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Law) An arrest or seizure; also, the heading of a legal document, stating where, when, and by what authority it was taken or executed.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （法律）逮捕或扣押；也指法律文件的标题，说明其采取或执行的地点、时间及授权机关。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The old legal text referenced a 'caption of error' as a formal objection.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这份古老的法律文本将“错误逮捕”引用为一项正式异议。

REGISTER: General usage for meanings 1 and 2, particularly common in media, publishing, and social media contexts. Meaning 3 is specific to legal and historical contexts and is rarely used today.
